Good place to stop for a quick drink though, and it's clean and civil looking enough that I wouldn't mind going back... But it's just not *that* memorable...
author: Denise C.

description:
Went to Bar Basic to celebrate a friend's bday and in tandem, celebrated the Giants win against Cleveland!  It was literally a win-win situation.  :)

Had a freakin' blast!  The bar is basic (ha!) and the crowd was mostly Asian (surprise, surprise).  But as the night wore off, it was just the Giants' crew, and it was fabulous.  

The drinks were tasty and if I remember correctly, at about 12:30pm, we all started dancing like maniacs.  A battle here, crazy moves there.  Mind you, it's a bar with I think a DJ???  So we literally danced in the middle of a bar.  Whatever!   The music was awesome. I haven't laughed, engaged in interesting conversation and had that much fun in weeks!  Forgot how great it was to hang with positive, fun people.
author: Soo Jin K.

description: My boyfriend and I had our first drink here two and a half years ago.  We've been inseparable ever since!  I don't remember too much about the service or ambiance, just that it facilitated great conversation, laughs and nervous arm rubs.  Lol.  Definitely a great memory.  Thanks Bar Basic!
author: Ronita J.

description:
Great HH Specials
Friendly bartenders
Nice relax lounge environment
Dog friendly
Comfy seating area
What's there not to love about this place?
author: Eva Y.

description:
On Tuesdays they serve the Hapa Food truck in the bar. 

With $5 martini happy hour and a small yet chill vibe. This isn't a bad place to kill an hour or three!

They have a Nintendo system with the Mario Bros and other old school games. I haven't played...but if I see Duck Hunt next time, IT'S ON!!!
author: Jay H.

description:
01.22.11

Was here for a charity event this past weekend.  Place was crowded with do-gooders (I do feel better that my booze $ is going towards something good).  Impossible to get any bartender's attention.  Impossible to squeeze yourself to the restroom.

Drink specials all night, if you get a chance to order.

Takorea parked out front.  Big plus.
author: Jenny L.

description: Drinks are cheap, easy-going vibe, easy parking....unfortunately, no bar food but I went on a Friday night around 8pm and there was a mexican food truck outside!
author: Emily Y.

description: Very basic...but friendly service, and $$ drinks - well worth the money.
author: Kristen S.

description:
This past Friday, I found out I passed the CA bar exam. 

Bar Basic is where I looked up my results.

Most people told me to go home to check, but I choose beer over boxes of kleenex. It worked out!

 With it's laid back vibe, free popcorn, decent drink  selection, and awesome advent of ROQBOT playing excellent music, Bar Basic was the perfect place to basically "bar" into the state of CA (get it?? get it?? I know, too lame and too soon). 

Go to Bar Basic. 

Drink up. 

And for all you CA Bar takers out there-- use Bar Basic as a good luck charm when the big day arrives. You won't be sorry!
author: Yaamini R.

description: I've been going to quite a few bars recently.  This place is really interesting...it is always nearly empty and has a weird vibe.  It looks like half of a dark, classy bar that merged with a sports bar with tvs everywhere, and then a huge glowing screen for tetris, and you can watch couples who don't want to talk to eachother anymore playing video games, their faces illuminated in the otherwise pitch-black darkness.  But if you're on a date, if you want to catch up with your friend, and you basically want to be able to hear the person you're with and not looking to meet random people or be with a huge rowdy group, then this is the place for you!  Completely chill, cheap drinks, and very friendly and kind, yes I said kind, bartenders.
author: Terry K.

description: I go to this bar all the time. It's so relaxed and full of cool people. They do trivia sometimes which is a blast, have an nes if that's your thing but it's such a nice escape from the more crowded clubs in SOMA. It is a bit of a dive in case that's a deal breaker!
author: Jon K.

description: Bar Basic is a basic bar, imagine that, right? I sat here for more than an hour waiting for my husband to get off the CalTrain during happy hour. The $5 martinis and dog friendly interior made it very comfortable for me. There was a video juke box that allowed customers to use an app on their phones to choose the music. This kept me entertained while I sat alone. It seemed like a locals place, as many of the patrons knew one another. A few talked to me and the staff was very friendly. I would go back if I make it to San Francisco again.
author: Stacie W.

description:
Came here for the $5 Martini Happy Hour.  I got the pomegranate martini and that was really good.  

The place is really chill.  Its a nice place to go when you want a few drinks, but not the crowd that comes with it.
author: Jacqueline P.

description: five pm caltrain arrival...a block walking and happy hour draft beer $four...weak cocktails $five...$one yelp check-in offer for regular priced drinks only...snes street fighter ii hooked up to old tube tv...challenge?...taking a modelo draft $four and another...friendly arriving for beers and cocktails...sticking to the modelo...modelo promotions lady arriving and passing out modelo samples...already drinking pint after pint of light and refreshing modelo...given another full pint for drinking modelo...non-crowded and fairly sparse in customers on a thursday after-work hours...good for drinks and original street fighter ii challenge...
author: Hen A.

description:
The couches are nice to sit on and the bar is pretty well stocked. The beer selection is somewhat lacking.

I ordered a beer and my friend got the Mango Martini. The beer was fine, after all it's just beer.

The Mango Martini though was quite terrible. It didn't taste like Mango and they used some really cheap tasting vodka.

Overall, it was an OK experience.
author: Colin Z.

description: Good size, used to be my local, good happy hour, good music. I think when the first time I stopped in here, I didn't love it because of the layout - but if you're just looking for a good chill place - this is solid.
author: Mayur A.

description:
Update: Nintendo is in service.

Also, Filipino food truck, when stationed outside; delicious.
author: Stephanie F.

description: I have zero complaints about Bar Basic. I went with a friend on a weeknight & it was the only place we could sit and talk in the neighborhood without crazy March Madness crowds destroying the ambiance. The beer was good, the price was right & I can't believe it took me so long to find this little gem.
author: Amber G.

description:
Mike the owner totally rocks my socks off. He serves some mean drinks, and has some pretty sexy bartenders. 

Great atmosphere, iPhone jukebox app (forget the name?), and they have NES. What more could you ask for? Food maybe? They got that... Taco trucks frequently visit this place. But if no taco truck, ask for popcorn.

Bar Basic, I love you long time.
author: Amanda B.

description:
The crowd is laid back and eclectic, the drinks are strong and tasty.  I'm quite a fan of the Gin Gimlet.

My only complaint: TVs!  I hate them!  So distracting!
author: Tessa M.

description: Some of my friends are regulars and after hanging out for most of the night last Friday, I can see why! Friendly staff, $5 cocktails during their happy hours, and pretty good music. It can get pretty loud in there during peak hours, but nothing too crazy.
author: Lily J.

description:
I'll admit they got me with the alliterated name. It really says it all. Good service and all the basics.

I work at a bar near by and this is the place I go to blow off steam. Ever since the first visit the bartenders have been welcoming and down to earth. Mike, J, and Brad make it a great place even when it's not busy.

Demographic seems to run on the Asian side and lots of Giants fans. The place gets happening starting Thursday. Bonus points for when the Korean taco truck is parked outside. Only wish they had Guinness on tap!
author: iheartpie s.

description:
Fantastic neighborhood bar.  I love stopping here for a quick drink on the way home from work.  If you take CalTrain into SF in the vening and then head home from there, stopping here is a must.

Also a great place to grab a drink before heading over to Coco 500 (right next door) or Zuppa (around the corner) for dinner.

My only complaint is that they get packed on key nights (Th through Sun) and I have a hard time finding a seat!  Otherwise they have it all--good drinks, the occasional food truck and friendly staff.  Oh. and they have roqbot.  Kind of cutting edge, imo.
author: Lynn G.

description:
Went here as a preparty for a friend's birthday celebration.

Philipino/Mexican Food stand outside has delicious spring rolls. You can bring the food inside where they have a long couch-type seating area and ottomans that you can move around and sit on as well as your standard seats at the bar.

Happy hour lasts until 9pm. They have $5 martinis and $3 draft. I got the pomegranate martini and it was tasty and strong. You must try the Shot Box! Chose a number and they give you a mystery shot based on your number! for $3!

Cool unique features: download the roqbot app and you can add songs to the bar's playlist! It's pretty entertaining to chose the songs and gets everybody engaged. They have a Nintendo set somewhere. i didn't play because I was engaged in lots of convo and silliness but it exists...

The crowd was lively. The bar tenders were friendly and efficient.

I had a great time and I felt like this bar really facilitated me and my friends hanging out, eating and drinking freely and to our heart's content.
author: Ama T.

description:
$5 happy hour martinis in six flavors? YES PLEASE!

Bar Basic is just about the perfect spot for that 5:30 PM drink with your co-workers. It's got good happy hour pricing, enough seating for its location, and a nice selection of music that is loud enough to enjoy but not so loud you can't hear your buddies bitching about their day.

Seoul on Wheels parks outside until 9 or so on Wednesdays, so if you like some food with your booze, try to aim for that. If you wind up here on a different day, the bartenders are down with you ordering a pizza to the bar or bringing whatever else inside, and they'll make popcorn if you just want a snack.

Overall a solid spot to do your everyday drinking.
author: Sam K.

description:
Been here twice this week.  Super chill atmosphere, not crowded on weekdays, well-made drinks with the right amount of... drink.  Comfy chairs, somewhat dimly-lit (but not too dimly!).

It's hard to really say much more.  I'm getting tired of crowded, noisy bars, where you have to spend 15 minutes just to get a bartender's attention.  This place makes me happy to avoid all that.

Just sad that the Nintendo is broken :(
author: Brian T.

description: There hasn't been a place so aptly named since maybe the dollar store. This place in all ways is simply basic. Their happy hour specials are pretty good but there's nothing to eat and the decor is average. I came here on a Friday evening and it wasn't very crowded which was unusual but fortunate because I could actually hear what my friend was saying. Overall a pretty relaxing atmosphere.
author: Dhivya S.

description: Greatest neighborhood dive bar.  Cheap drinks, dogs allowed, no frills but great as to what it is.
author: Sheetal P.

description:
This place is pretty basic (hehe).  I think you would miss it if you didn't know where to find it.  I only saw it because I happened to be using the ATM across the street and the distance was a major selling point.  But even at first we were like uh what is that place? hmm, where?  right there...is that a bar? is it even open?  luckily for us it was.

i love bars that defy the implied time frame of a "happy hour" and this does...as happy hour goes m-f from 5-9.  Awesome.  Martini's are five dollars and beer one dollar off.  They have super mario brothers and duck hunt.  Which at first you are like awesome...but then you are like uh...nah.  I mean if im gonna play video games with a friend ill buy a six pack and drink at home...

Its very loungey and swanky.  Dark brown...modern seating.  Though its a big place the seating just goes around the wall so I don't know how easy it would be to get seating on a weekend night...

Its hard because its a good bar, but there are just so many great bars in SOMA.  Not saying I won't be back, but I may try a few others before.  

Oh but there was a dog in the bar.  which was totally awesome...
author: Kierstan G.

description:
This bar is a cross between dive and trendy...the bartenders are awesome...we (mu buddy and I) nicknamed one of the girls Apple for the heck of it and she kept it going lol...I believe her real name was stephanie, and it's def. because of her that we'd go back. 

My friend threw her bday celebration there, and the bottle service was awesome, the atmosphere was fun, friendly and most importantly WITHOUT DRAMA! 

They have a super nintendo that people can play, the dj keeps the tracks goin with a great variety of music to move to.
author: Jim C.

description: Good drinks, good seating, and three TVs.  Ideal for any sports event, plus they let you bring in any outside food.
author: Tina L.

description:
Drinking spiked Arnold Palmers in plastic cups while dancing obnoxiously to 90s Top 40 music?  Yes, please.

Kicking it with old and new friends in a chill place? Yes, please.

Supporting my aZn brother? Yes, please.  (The owner isn't actually my brother from the same mother, but he is Asian and he is a friend of a friend)

Stumbling out to purchase Chicken Adobo and fried pork deliciousness from the Hapa truck right outside?  Yes, please.
author: Vi H.

description:
Despite Jeff S's insistence, this bar is NOT in the financial district.  It's smack dab in SoMa and used to be the Gallery Lounge (what are they drinking in Cupertino?).

Bar Basic lives up to its name: Nothing on the walls, a long black banquette along the wall opposite the bar with seating cubes and some short tables.  All of this is fine.  It's the theme and the look they're going for.  I get it.  I found the seating comfortable and useful.  Not all bars can offer this.

I had a Widmer Hefeweizen to drink and it was a little lukewarm if I'm being honest.  Call me an American, but certain beers should be cold, and I count hefeweizen among them. But, who cares, right? I can forgive beer that not cold enough.

What I can't forgive is the lack of attention to customer service.  After enduring the incredibly loud music playing overhead (why does this place even need a DJ?), I asked if the bartender could turn it down just a little.  I was literally yelling my conversation with my friends--as were other patrons.  The only people who seemed to be fine with the sonic chaos was the birthday group in the back to which the "DJ" seemed to belong.  To her credit, she asked Mr. DJ to turn it down and he did--for about 5 minutes.  Then, the music (which was also inappropriate for the space and them--basic it was not: techno/industrial does not make me think "basic.") volume crept back up.  

Eventually, it was so loud, we decided against a second drink (we went to Marlowe instead).  I left the bar, decided I had to say something to the bartender, and went back in.  She seemed surprised that I thought it was loud and said she had asked the DJ to turn it down a little.  I responded that he had subsequently turned it back up, so she offered to ask again.  Of course, I was leaving at that point, so it didn't matter.

I guess I have to ask: Who's running Bar Basic? The DJ and his friends or a savvy business person who wants to cultivate a neighborhood clientele?  Turn down the volume, BB, and maybe I'll be back.
author: Todd X.

description: "Dive" sports bar in the SOMA.  This place is pretty nice.  If you want a Dive Bar check out Coaches in Fremont.  Thats a DIVE bar.  This place is cool cuz it was easy to find a seat at the bar while watching the Warriors lose to the Spurs.  Lame asses.  After the game the owner turned Twilight on.  I guess the patrons of the bar are a bunch of tweens.
author: Fatty A.

description:
Friends and I usually end up at Bar Basic when we're looking for a low-key evening b/c it's a shorter walk than to Lava and not as divey as Utah up the street. Most of the time the vibe is pretty laid back and I enjoy frequenting a bar where no one is going to do a double take regardless of whether I walk in donning stilettos or wearing a potato sack. It's an honest, clean, unpretentious bar where you can cuddle with your honey on the lounge sofa bordering the wall (not me) or kvetch to your friends at the stools while watching hockey (totes me).

I think the drinks here are decent although on one occassion, one of the bartenders totally messed up my cocktail of choice: Manhattan. It tasted absolutely horrendous but I choked it down anyway; after that incident, I wisened up and started asking for the drink to be made a certain (the right) way (stirred, not shaken, pls!). Surprisingly, one of the 'guest' bartenders one night did a great job of mixing me my drink despite her admittance to not having much experience with that cocktail. 

My geek friends enjoy using the RoqBot and I'm always excited when I see their usernames on the screen... b/c I'm a simpleton like that.

Belonging to one of the staff members is a cute dog (milo?) that runs around the establishment sometimes. The fact that they dress him up occasionally bumps this place from a 3.0 to a 3.5 for me.
author: Ida C.

description: cool bar to hang out with friends. I little pricey but I am sure because of the location. It is kinda of cool that they let you play Super Nintendo!
author: Fabio C.

description: My boyfriend and I came here to have a drink before going to Fringale at 8pm on a Saturday night. The place was completely empty, but we were fine just enjoying a beverage and playing with the SNES. It's not surprising that my buttons on the controller was not working so well since hundreds of people have probably used them (wash your hands after you play!). It is a good concept to have a bar and I can imagine it being a blast with more people at the bar. The drinks were done fine - I had a peach martini and the boy had a jack and diet. Prices were probably around $10/drink - that's SF for ya right? Overall, this was a good place to hang out for a bit, but I wouldn't think to want to spend the whole night there even if it was full of people. Other than the SNES and the iPhone app controlled music radio, there's not much else going for it.
author: Diana U.

description:
This bar is great... Bar Staff is the best.. they wouldn't make you drink and drive... they'd call a cab for you or even drive you back.. 

Atmosphere is awesome, prices are cool, Kimchee taco trucks stop by.. awesome place.. Music is legit..
author: Enrique M.

description:
I love this place. Its small and I like the vibe. I've only been during the week for afterwork drinks and I absolutely love that they have Roqbot. I wish more bars had Roqbot. 

Also they have old school nintendo hooked up with all sorts of games.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Bar Basic isn't really what I call a dive bar. The furniture is nice, it has cool loungey areas and interesting paintings on the wall. The friendly staff is great and the best part is that you can bring in your pooch to hang out with you while you play super Nintendo. Everytime we go in, the owner automatically puts in tetris for us. TETRIS WARS!
author: Mina B.

description:
I meandered over to Bar Basic for their 1920s themed special event. They handed everyone some fake money to gamble on the black jack tables they set up. The event seemed like a hit; the person who won the most money won a grand prize. 

As for the bar itself, there was plenty of seating and cheap drinks. I ordered a gin gimlet and it was only $5! I liked that there were lots of tables and seats that were up for grabs (no need for a reservation). I'm not sure I would send the entire night here since I didn't see a dance floor. However, I'd definitely be back for a laid back night with some friends for some drinks!
author: Angela L.

description: My college alumn network of crazy folks are all over the world and all over the map.  Mike I wish you nothing but the best in your new venture!  Used to be the Gallery Lounge.....now Bar Basic.. I like lots
author: Vicky T.

description:
This is right around the corner from our office and is quickly becoming one of my favorite watering holes. Happy Hour prices are fair and the it's sort of off the beaten path so you're not fighting for a place to sit. It's a perfect for a place to grab a drink and have good conversation because you can actually hear the person next to you. 

I'm a big fan, will definitely be going back soon
author: Tien H.

description: Good location in SOMA if you are driving and parking and far enough from the Market street bar hopping crazies.  Bar Basic is a decent hole in the wall bar. It's actually fairly spacious and is pretty clean. I have been to a few parties here. I really liked the specialty drink menu. I'd probably come here again for happy hour and what not.
author: Sonya T.

description:
I like Bar Basic.  It lives up to it's name.  Long narrow bar, not too fancy, not too divey, just right.  Happy Hour from 5-9pm every day, good selection of tequilas, whiskeys, vodkas, beers, etc.  Some of the aspects of the bar are still under construction, but if you are in the area, waiting for a table next door, or around the corner, you should swing by for a drink.

Seating is decent, loungish in style, with a long white quartz bar.  Their bartenders all seem pretty well rounded in mixology, and the owner is a nice guy.  It has the feel of a neighborhood bar, with an upscale vibe.

3 Big HD tvs with individual tuners and the bartenders are open to putting pretty much whatever you want to watch up on any one of them whenever you want. But there are typically sports on at least 2 of the 3 screens.   Overall, I would say this place is a great spot to grab a drink either before a Giant's game, or while waiting for the next CalTrain to arrive/depart.
author: Chris P.

description: Just another 'basic bar'. If you simply want to grab a drink and have a chat with one or two of your friends, this is a good place to go. One thing i like about this place is that it has rockbot - a jukebox app that can be downloaded on your iphone. You can simply vote for the next song you want to play. I also saw a 90's nintendo console there, but havent seen anyone play it though. Watch out for an asian bartender guy though. He isn't mostly there, but he once charged me a dollar extra for a drink. Not a big deal, but still.
author: Lijo L.

description:
Bar basic (formerly known as galleria)  is a hidden gem in the financial district near embarcadero; the perfect place to relax after a long day of work. It has nice new decor with interesting drinks, and you definitely can get some good drinks without spending a grip during happy hour.  Music is a mix of top 40 and alternative but the friendly owner is open to any music suggestion!

Having convenient street parking nearby is definitely a plus too!!  Can't wait to check out the place when it's remodeled.
author: Jeff S.

description: Drink. A very friendly bar to come to. I enjoy how it is near the train station so if I have a tough day, and can co e unwind here. Also the fact they have old school street fighter ll up In There makes it better. They have a fine selection, however I always stick to my Guinness.
author: Nye T.

description:
This chill little bar is around the corner for those who want to escape the clusterfuck that is The Grand.

There's lots of seating here, and it's dog friendly.  I remember it being super loud inside though so please spare your dog's hearing and leave him at home.

It's not really somewhere I can see myself hanging out at for more than 1 or 2 drinks, but it's a good place to start the night off at.

We got a round of Dark and Foggys and they were awful.  I can handle some pretty bad rum drinks but I have no idea what was in this-- there was no syrup or citrus, that's for sure.  Disappointing, but I'll be back for the venue itself.
author: S L.

description: I'm a fan.  Good ambiance, not too crowded, great bartenders who know how to make a perfect dirty martini.  Great for a chill drink with friends or as a prelude to going big somewhere else in the city.  And how can you not love the mystery box-o-shots?!
author: Max B.

description: The perfect local bar!  Amazing selections of beers, wines and liquors, great & fun cocktails, and a cool but not "too cool" bar staff.  If you live in the area or you're headed to a Giants game, you should make plans on meeting at Bar Basic!
author: Plaid B.

description:
A chill neighborhood bar with a nice vibe.  The bar has decent prices and since the new renovations the inside of the bar is pretty nice as well.  

Its a nice place to hang out before the Giant's games for some pre-game beers or grab an extra post game beer (or two).
author: Alex P.

description: This bar is pretty basic. Shocker, I know. Decent amount of seating, tvs playing games, and the music is controlled via guests' iphones. The wine list is rather small, but in line with what I would expect from a place like this. Might go back if I'm in the area...it's right by the cal train stop which is nice.
author: Gina C.

description: Missed the Caltrain south so we stopped in here to kill some time. Had the Giants game on, plenty of seating, good selection of spirits and brews. Kinda mix between swank and dive, I guess that's the SF special though. Would def head there again if I were to miss another train.
author: Justin M.

description: $5 martinis for happy hour, and an NES with a bunch of great games for everyone to try and fail to drunkenly play.  The sports crowd can be a bit unruly at times but who cares.  It's a cheap, basic bar that gets those basics down pat.
author: J S.

description: As their name applies, this is a great "basic" bar, but with great happy hour deals and lots of TVs to watch the games.  You can either comfortably lounge on benches or sit at the bar. If you're in the area and are looking for a no frills drink to catch up with some friends this is a great stop.
author: Nick E.

description: Plain and simple, this is a good place to get drunk. There. I said it. The drinks are strong and cheap (especially with the ridiculously long happy hour- I mean, it goes until 9pm. Where else do you know has a happy hour until 9pm?!), it's not usually crowded, and the bartenders are friendly. Actually, the crowd kind of ebbs & flows here- sometimes it's dead, sometimes it's packed- but we always have a good time here. Some nights they have djs; the rest of the time they have something called Roqbot, which is awesome bc you can pick songs you want to hear with it. Plus, you can order in food if you want. No bones about it, it's not a fancy trendy bar, but it's a good solid let's have an f'in no frills DRINK bar.
author: Kristen L.

description: 3 words. NBA Jam: TE. They have the classic video game on SNES
author: Chadwick L.

description: Bar basic is a good neighborhood bar with happy hour from 4-9pm and game day specials. It's a good spot to catch a quick drink after work or sit down and watch football.
author: Jermaine R.

description:
I like this place! They have a great hh that lasts till late and their sweet tea lemonade vodka drink is great. The staff is nice and there is free popcorn and an old school Nintendo available.

The bar looks unassuming from outside, but the inside is nice and clean and very comfortable.

Great spot to drink at before a game.
author: Catherine H.

description: I held a party at Bar Basic, and I must say it was very delightful. The place was clean and very neat. I would recommend to anyone to hold an event at this place. Five Stars.
author: Dean C.

description: Low key, good drinks, loved the Roqbot.  But the best part was the dog sitting at the bar.
author: Ashley F.

description: A great neighborhood bar -- Relaxed, non-pretentious, friendly, and a great place to watch games. Happy hour 4:00 to 9:00. RoqBot is fun. Weekends seem to have a lot of overflow from The Grand, so watch out for that!
author: Stephen D.

description: The one star is for the bartender. The rest is for the "owner" "Mike". Way to not care about your customers. I tried to ask Mr. Know-It-All about the drink menu and he responded the same way anyone who knows nothing about cocktails would: "it is a really well known drink." No creativity, no customer service, and no class.
author: Rikus L.

description: Two stars because it's right by the house in soma and the remodel is cool. Not sure if it's just me but the service is aweful every time I come. The bar tenders have a bad tendency to be unfriendly and ignore you even when it's slow. My beers have been warm in the past and they seem to be lacking one mixer or the other. In my opinion gallery was waayyy cooler and the bar tender was friendly and attentive. I'll come back because it's close to home but I'll bitch and moan about it.
author: Omar M.

description: It wasnt like a bad ass bar that was jumpin with people but.it was entertaining and they have mike tyson punchout!
author: Joshua P.

description: This is definitely a good find. It has a laid-back feel, good music and cheap drinks for happy hour! The owner Mike is super friendly. This is definitely a good spot to go for drinks with friends and colleagues on a weekday afternoon without breaking the bank.
author: Kyle L.

description: It's really 3 stars but 1 star for the Korean taco truck that comes by on weekend nights and parks out front until 2 am...and 1 extra star for being only 2 blocks away from home. It's a laid back place, the bartender was pretty cool - the only thing was it was pretty empty the one time I went. Maybe it's more of a Happy Hour place. I'll definitely go back though. Heck, maybe I'll go tonight.
author: Bern H.

description: Great drinks, big space, perfect for happy hour. Too bad they don't have free snacks like Gallery Lounge had :) But can't wait to go back for the food trucks!
author: Christina G.

description: They have happy hour all week!  Its a great find for me, since I work near there.  It has a nice lounge feel without the usual clientele.  Great place to take your co-workers...I just wish they served food.
author: LIVE to E.

description: The name doesn't lie.  This bar exudes a minimalist style, but isn't boring to look at.  Less is more!  I enjoyed my Ketel dirty martinis and the tunes in the background.  The service was friendly and prices were reasonable.  A cool, casual spot...just wish there was more parking around there!
author: Linda P.

description: Went here for a friend's birthday last night. The atmosphere & crowd were nice, but the drinks, while reasonably priced, were so incredibly weak that none of us felt there was any alcohol in them. 6 bucks for a glass of soda water, that's what it felt like. If you come here, stick to beer & wine. Other than this, the place has potential.
author: SL N.

description: love this place! i've been going here for a few months and it's a great happy hour. bar tenders are friendly and the vibe is casual/laid back. if you work in the soma area and need a new place to relax in the evenings, this should be one of your spots
author: Kevin D.

description: Not a bad place to chill out at on a Friday night. Doesn't get too packed and the music is good and the bartenders are friendly. There is a Korean taco truck that chills outside on certain days so you can hit that place up for some spicy tacos. ;)
author: Irene L.

description: Nice, low-key space to grab a few drinks. My peach martini was crazy strong. Apparently the food truck is there Thursdays-Saturdays, so I'm definitely coming back to check it out.
author: T. M.

description: great bar. no cover, friendly service, strong and tasty drinks.  one of fave spots to go after work.  only wish the had bar food as an option.
author: Fres R.

description: I love the dark, "loungey" feel of this bar.  Great place to sit around, have a drink, listen to music, and be anonymous.  I like hanging out with the locals or sitting around talking to the bartender/owner.  He's just so freaking adorable.  Need a place to disappear for a while?  This is the place to do it.
author: H B.

description: My first experience at Bar Basic was for a friend's bday. I will have to say, the crowd in there earlier in the night was a little odd...but they were having a good time. I like that it is a smaller bar, reasonable drink prices, and friendly service. My last experience there, they got me throughly wasted...I appreciated that. This is a good, comfortable, non-pretentious place to have good drinks and hang out with your friends.
author: Matt K.
